newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norwegian shares end flat, market seen cautious.
newsitem.headline: Norwegian shares end flat, market seen cautious.

text.p: Norwegian shares ended flat on Wednesday following stronger-than-expected first-quarter GDP figures from the United States.
Oslo's Total index finished 0.01 percent lower at 1,096.66 in moderate trade worth 880 million crowns.
Trading on the bourse was interrupted for about an hour in the afternoon because of a technical snag and was resumed just minutes before the session ended at 1500gmt.
Dealers said major players appeared to sit on the sidelines waiting for impulses from international markets.
"Sentiment in the Norwegian market is not entirely good for the moment even though bank results...are positive," one said.

Christiania Bank og Kreditkasse, which announced strong first-quarter profits on Tuesday, was the most traded share at 93 million crowns. It fell about eight percent, or two crowns, to 22.20 crowns following a 1996 dividend payment of 1.55 crowns.
Industrial group Norsk Hydro was the second most traded share at 65 million crowns and fell 0.90 percent, or three crowns, to 347 crowns.
